Rule.NonCompliantComment: Packages are being obtained from unauthorized repositories, which may lead to installing unverified or malicious software.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure PostgreSQL packages are obtained from authorized repositories such as the official PostgreSQL YUM (yum.postgresql.org) or APT (apt.postgresql.org) repositories.
Rule.Correction: Manual review required to ensure packages are obtained only from authorized repositories.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: Unnecessary PostgreSQL packages are installed, increasing the attack surface.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Only required PostgreSQL packages should be installed, such as the server and client packages. Optional modules should be avoided unless necessary.
Rule.Correction: Manual review required to identify and uninstall unnecessary PostgreSQL packages.
Rule.Verification: dpkg -l | grep postgresql || rpm -qa | grep postgresql

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The PostgreSQL systemd service file is not enabled, which may cause the database service to be inactive after a reboot.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure PostgreSQL systemd service file is enabled to automatically start at boot.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The PostgreSQL data cluster has not been initialized correctly, which may lead to a failed installation or misconfiguration.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the PostgreSQL data cluster is properly initialized using the initdb command.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The PostgreSQL server does not have the latest security patches applied, leaving it vulnerable to known security flaws.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure the latest PostgreSQL security patches are installed using the package manager (apt or dnf/yum).
Rule.Correction: Manual review required. Use apt-get upgrade or dnf update to apply the latest patches.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'PGPASSWORD' environment variable is set in user profiles, which may expose database credentials.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'PGPASSWORD' is not set in user profile files (.bashrc, .profile) to prevent exposure of database passwords.

Rule.NonCompliantComment: The 'PGPASSWORD' environment variable is currently in use by a running process, exposing the database password.
Rule.CorrectiveComment: Ensure 'PGPASSWORD' is not set as an environment variable for any running process.
Rule.Correction: Manual review required to identify and remove the environment variable from any running process.
